page.title: 03GAWSWORTH HALL
page.content: Gawsworth Hall. The ancient Manor of Gawsworth has been held by only five families since Norman times. The de Orreby family 1130-1316 The Fitton family 1316-1662 Earls of Macclesfield 1662-1702 Earls of Harrington 1727-1937 Roper-Richards of Macclesfield 1937+ Mary Fitton was the possible "dark lady" of Shakespeare's sonnets and Samuel Johnson,the last professional jester in England lived in the house, the eccentric Mr.Johnson lies buried in "Maggoty Johnson's Wood." The present hall dates from the second half of the fifteenth century and is based on a quadrangular design. The first mention of a hall is in an entry found in Lichfield Episcopal Register of 1365.
